revision.text:
{{Use dmy dates|date=May 2014}} {{Infobox person | image = | image_size = | name = Ann Gloag | caption = | birth_name = Ann Heron Souter | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1942|12|10|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Perth, Scotland|Perth]], Scotland | death_date = | death_place = | ethnicity = | residence = [[Kinfauns Castle]], [[Perth and Kinross]], [[Scotland]] | education = [[Perth High School]] | known for = Co-founder, [[Stagecoach Group]] | networth = GBP £1.04 billion (April 2015)<ref name=STRL>{{cite news|title=Sunday Times Rich List|work=The Sunday Times|issue=page 33|date=26 April 2014}}</ref> | website = [http://www.gloagfoundation.org.uk The Gloag Foundation] }}
'''Ann Gloag''' [[Order of the British Empire|OBE]] (born '''Ann Heron Souter'''; 10 December 1942, in [[Perth, Scotland|Perth]]) is a Scottish business woman and charity campaigner. She is co-founder of the international transport company [[Stagecoach Group]].
==Biography== Educated at Caledonian Road Primary School and [[Perth High School]], she qualified as a nurse , and during a 20-year career worked as a burn unit sister. She is ranked as Scotland's richest woman.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.scottish-places.info/scotgaz/people/famousfirst527.html|title=Overview of Ann Heron Gloag|publisher=Scottish-places.info|accessdate=20 May 2014}}</ref>
===Stagecoach=== Using her father's redundancy money, and working with her brother [[Brian Souter|Sir Brian Souter]] and her first husband [[Robin Gloag]], Gloag established the Stagecoach Group in 1980, running buses from Dundee to London. Expansion continued and in the early 1990s, Stagecoach acquired National Bus Company operations in Cumberland, Hampshire, East Midlands, Ribble, Southdown and the United Counties. Stagecoach bought further bus operations in Scotland, Newcastle and London, with Manchester being added in 1993.{{citation needed|date=August 2014}}
===Manston Airport=== In November 2013, Gloag took ownership of [[Kent International Airport]], also known as [[Manston Airport]] for the sum of [[Pound sterling|£1]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-kent-24532999|title=Manston Airport sold to Stagecoach founder for £1|website=Bbc.co.uk|date=15 October 2013|accessdate=20 May 2014}}</ref> Gloag's co-director is [[Pauline Bradley]],<ref>{{cite web|author=Pauline Bradley|url=http://investing.businessweek.com/research/stocks/private/person.asp?personId=29536681&privcapId=13705047|title=Pauline Bradley: Executive Profile|website=Investing.businessweek.com|accessdate=20 May 2014}}</ref> a corporate lawyer and former head of joint ventures at [[Bank of Scotland]], described by the Scottish Herald as "''one of Scotland's most powerful women''".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.heraldscotland.com/sport/spl/aberdeen/head-of-joint-ventures-at-bos-quits-to-join-kenmore-1.65525|title=Head of joint ventures at BoS quits to join Kenmore|publisher=Herald Scotland|date=19 January 2005|accessdate=20 May 2014}}</ref>
Despite assurances to staff regarding long term investment in the airport,<ref>[http://www.eveningtelegraph.co.uk/news/local/ann-gloag-believes-1-manston-airport-will-take-off-1.142397%20] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140521012433/http://www.eveningtelegraph.co.uk/news/local/ann-gloag-believes-1-manston-airport-will-take-off-1.142397%20|date=21 May 2014}}</ref> management announced a consultation on closure in April 2014.
Uncertainty about the airport's future led flight operators who were using Manston to leave, notably [[KLM]] who ran a twice daily service to [[Amsterdam Airport Schiphol|Amsterdam Schiphol]]. A number of bids were forthcoming during the consultation period to buy and run the airport,<ref name="kentonline1">{{cite web|last=Price|first=Chris|url=http://www.kentonline.co.uk/kent-business/county-news/dramatic-last-minute-offer-for-17318|title=Manston airport: Dramatic last-minute offer to buy Thanet site by US group RiverOak rejected as staff leave for last time|publisher=Kentonline.co.uk|date=15 May 2014|accessdate=20 May 2014}}</ref> but on 15 May 2014 Manston was closed with the loss of 144 jobs in the airport and an unknown number in the surrounding area. Gloag did not appear publicly or give a reason for the airport's closure or her refusal to sell. The [[trade union]] Unite said it would challenge the way the consultation on closure was conducted.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/travel/travelnews/10813475/Manston-Airport-closure-bizarre-says-union.html|title=Manston Airport closure 'bizarre', says union|publisher=Telegraph|accessdate=20 May 2014}}</ref> [[Roger Gale|Sir Roger Gale]], [[Member of Parliament]] for [[North Thanet (UK Parliament constituency)|Thanet North]], described Gloag's actions as an act of "corporate vandalism".<ref name="kentonline1"/>
{{As of|2016}}, Gale and pressure groups including ''Save Manston Airport'' and ''Why Not Manston?'' continue to campaign for the reopening of the airport and have opposed alternative uses. In May 2014, then [[Prime Minister of the UK|prime minister]] [[David Cameron]], in answer to a question from Gale in the [[House of Commons of the United Kingdom|Houses of Commons]], stated that the future of Manston was the responsibility of the airport owner, but the Government was in negotiation with Mrs Gloag.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://publications.parliament.uk/pa/cm201314/cmhansrd/cm140514/debtext/140514-0001.htm|title=House of Commons Hansard Debates for 14 May 2014 (pt 0001)|publisher=Publications.parliament.uk|accessdate=20 May 2014}}</ref> In July 2017 planning inspectors rejected an appeal stating that the site was protected for aviation use under EC4 regulations.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.kentnews.co.uk/business/war-of-words-continues-as-planning-chiefs-refuse-change-of-use-of-buildings-at-manston-airport-1-5106233|title=War of words continues as planning chiefs refuse change of use of buildings at Manston airport|first=Tom|last=Pyman|website=Kentnews.co.uk|accessdate=11 November 2017}}</ref>
==Personal life== Gloag has owned [[Beaufort Castle, Scotland|Beaufort Castle]] near [[Inverness]] since 1995, and [[Kinfauns Castle]], near [[Perth, Scotland|Perth]] since 2004. She has attempted to block off private access at Kinfauns in a high-profile case.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://thescotsman.scotsman.com/index.cfm?id=819912006|title=The Scotsman|publisher=Thescotsman.scotsman.com|date=2 June 2006|accessdate=20 May 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/scotland/tayside_and_central/5040326.stm|work=BBC News|title=Tycoon launches court access bid|date=2 June 2006|accessdate=25 April 2010}}</ref> On 12 June 2007 she was successful in gaining a court ruling that she was legally entitled to bar the public from a swath of woodland in the grounds of Kinfauns Castle.<ref>{{cite news|first=Severin|last=Carrell|title=Multimillionaire uses financial muscle to bar ramblers from woods|url=https://www.theguardian.com/country/article/0,,2102624,00.html|work=The Guardian|date=14 June 2007|accessdate=14 June 2007|location=London, UK}}</ref>
Her ex-husband, [[Robin Gloag]], was killed in a car crash on 6 December 2007.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/scotland/tayside_and_central/7130178.stm|title=Gloag's ex-husband dies in crash|publisher=BBC News|date=6 December 2007|accessdate=20 May 2014}}</ref> Their son, Jonathan, killed himself in 1999, aged 28.<ref name=scotsman>{{cite news|url=http://www.scotsman.com/news/saturday-profile-brian-souter-1-595815|title=Saturday Profile: Brian Souter|publisher=[[The Scotsman]]|date=2 February 2002 |accessdate=8 November 2013}}</ref>
A member of the [[Church of the Nazarene]],<ref>{{cite news|title=Tayside Police launch abuse handling investigation|url=http://www.scotsman.com/news/tayside-police-launch-abuse-handling-investigation-1-835093|accessdate=30 July 2012|newspaper=The Scotsman|date=21 November 2010}}</ref> she founded the Freedom From Fistula Foundation. After meeting [[Adam Friedman]], she became executive producer of ''[[Shout Gladi Gladi]]'', a documentary film explaining the medical and social issues surrounding [[obstetric fistula]] in Africa.
==References== {{Reflist}}
==External links== * [http://www.scottish-places.info/people/famousfirst527.html Profile], scottish-places.info; accessed 10 December 2015. {{StagecoachGroup}} {{Authority control}}

revision.text:
{{Infobox company |logo = BenevolentAI logo.png |image = BenevolentAI office.jpg | type = Private | traded_as = NYSE: FTCH | industry = Artificial Intelligence, neuroscience | founded = November 13, 2013 | hq_location_city = London, England | key_people = Brent Gutekunst, Ivan Griffin, Ken Mulvany, Michael Brennan, CEO, Baroness Joanna Shields | num_employees = 51 – 100 }}
'''BenevolentAI''' is a UK-based artificial intelligence company. They operate under the mission to change the way medicine is designed, developed, tested and brought to market through computational medicine and AI technology<ref>{{cite web |title=About Us |url=https://benevolent.ai/about-us |website=BenevolentAI |accessdate=27 November 2018}}</ref>. It is a fully integrated AI company with pharmaceutical discovery and clinical development capabilities<ref>{{cite web |title=BenevolentAI Raises $115 Million to Extend Its Leading Global Position in the Field of AI Enabled Drug Development |url=https://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/benevolentai-raises-115-million-to-extend-its-leading-global-position-in-the-field-of-ai-enabled-drug-development-680180573.html |website=PR Newswire |accessdate=27 November 2018}}</ref>.
The company has developed the Benevolent Platform™, which as of 2018 is the world’s only end-to-end computational and experimental platform for drug discovery; BenevolentAI scientists use the platform to find new ways to treat disease and personalise drugs to patients<ref>{{cite web |last1=Liu |first1=Angus |title=BenevolentAI's Proximagen buy creates first AI firm capable of entire drug R&D |url=https://www.fiercebiotech.com/biotech/proximagen-buy-creates-first-ai-firm-capable-entire-drug-r-d-benevolentai |website=Fierce Biotech |publisher=Questex |accessdate=25 November 2018}}</ref>. The Benevolent Platform™ continuously ingests and analyses unstructured and structured biomedical information, from academic papers to compound databases, to clinical trials, to scientific patents. This information is combined with deep learning to create a bioscience knowledge graph coupled with an automated platform for hypothesis generation and validation followed by the design, refinement and synthesis of molecules<ref>{{cite web |last1=Shields |first1=Joanna |title=Why we need to use AI for life not just lifestyle |url=https://benevolent.ai/blog/why-we-need-to-use-ai-for-life-not-just-lifestyle1 |website=BenevolentAI |publisher=BenevolentAI |accessdate=26 November 2018}}</ref>.
The company is headquartered in King’s Cross, London with a research facility in Cambridge (UK) and additional offices based in New York and Belgium<ref>{{cite web |last1=Medeiros |first1=João |title=This AI unicorn is disrupting the pharma industry in a big way |url=https://www.wired.co.uk/article/benevolent-ai-london-unicorn-pharma-startup |website=WIRED |publisher=WIRED |accessdate=26 November 2018}}</ref>. On keeping the company headquartered in London, founder Mulvany has said “There's a real opportunity to build a business in this country, and there's an opportunity for the country to lead this sector, and all the pieces are in place. We've got incredible scientists, incredible mathematicians, we're able to draw all these people into London."<ref>{{cite web |last1=Shona |first1=Ghosh |title=A British tech unicorn is trying to cure Alzheimer's and ALS with artificial intelligence |url=https://www.businessinsider.com/benevolent-ai-ceo-ken-mulvany-interview-2017-4 |website=Business Insider |publisher=Business Insider |accessdate=25 November 2018}}</ref> BenevolentAI has active R&D drug programmes from discovery to PhaseIIb in disease areas such as ALS, Parkinson’s, Ulcerative Colitis and Sarcopenia<ref>{{cite web |last1=Brackley |first1=Paul |title=BenevolentAI founder Ken Mulvany on using artificial intelligence to find new drugs to tackle disease |url=http://www.cambridgeindependent.co.uk/business/science/benevolentai-founder-ken-mulvany-on-using-artificial-intelligence-to-find-new-drugs-to-tackle-disease-1-5429242 |website=Cambridge Independent |publisher=Cambridge |accessdate=26 November 2018}}</ref>.
Horizons Ventures advisor Bart Swanson is a board member; shareholders include Richard Farleigh, a high profile angel investor<ref>{{cite web |last1=Ghosh |first1=Shona |title=A British tech unicorn is trying to cure Alzheimer's and ALS with artificial intelligence |url=https://www.businessinsider.com/benevolent-ai-ceo-ken-mulvany-interview-2017-4 |website=Business Insider |publisher=Business Insider |accessdate=26 November 2018}}</ref>.
== Company History == BenevolentAI was founded in November 2013 by Ken Mulvany<ref>{{cite web |last1=Lunden |first1=Ingrid |title=BenevolentAI, which uses AI to develop drugs and energy solutions, nabs $115M at $2B valuation |url=https://techcrunch.com/2018/04/18/benevolentai-which-uses-ai-to-develop-drugs-and-energy-solutions-nabs-115m-at-2b-valuation/ |website=TechCrunch |publisher=TechCrunch |accessdate=20 November 2018}}</ref>. Initially the company focussed on the development of a cross functional AI technology to incorporate basic science, chemistry and clinical components and designed that could ingest, read and contextualise the world’s available bioscience information<ref>{{cite web |last1=BenevolentAI |title=BenevolentAI Raises $115 Million to Extend Its Leading Global Position in the Field of AI Enabled Drug Development |url=https://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/benevolentai-raises-115-million-to-extend-its-leading-global-position-in-the-field-of-ai-enabled-drug-development-680180573.html |website=PR Newswire |publisher=Cision |accessdate=25 November 2018}}</ref>.
Throughout the course of 2014 and 2015 the technology was further developed to also reason and propose hypotheses to treat disease. By 2015, the company had raised $87 million in funding, including investors like Woodford Investment Management and Lansdowne Partners<ref>{{cite web |last1=Taylor |first1=Nick Paul |title= MedTech BenevolentAI bags $115M to fuel AI-enabled R&D push |url=https://www.fiercebiotech.com/medtech/benevolentai-bags-115m-to-fuel-ai-enabled-r-d-push |website=Fierce Biotech |publisher=Questex |accessdate=28 November 2018}}</ref>. In 2015 BenevolentAI began to fully apply its technology to drug discovery and development and announced the appointment of Jackie Hunter to lead bioscience research at the company<ref>{{cite web |last1=BenevolentAI |title=BenevolentAI, the pioneering London-based company using artificial intelligence to advance pharmaceutical development, appoints head of BBSRC as new Chief Executive |url=https://benevolent.ai/news/announcements/benevolentai-appoints-jackie-hunter-as-ceo-of-benevolentbio |website=BenevolentAI |publisher=BenevolentAI |accessdate=23 November 2018}}</ref>.
During 2016 further early drug R&D programmes were established and an in-license deal completed with J&J for novel clinical stage drug candidates<ref>{{cite web |title=Exclusive license agreement with Janssen for clinical stage drug candidates |url=https://benevolent.ai/news/announcements/british-artificial-intelligence-firm-announces-exclusive-license-agreement-with-janssen |website=BenevolentAI |publisher=BenevolentAI |accessdate=24 November 2018}}</ref>. That year BenevolentAI also initiated their first full drug programmes for ALS, and indicated in a later press release positive results from the initial data<ref>{{cite web |title=AI enabled research shows delay in onset of motor neurone disease |url=https://benevolent.ai/news/announcements/ai-enabled-research-shows-delay-in-onset-of-motor-neurone-disease |website=BenevolentAI |publisher=BenevolentAI |accessdate=23 November 2018}}</ref>.
2017 saw the company file its first Investigational New Drug (IND) application. In February 2018, BenevolentAI acquired a Cambridge research facility in order to expand its capabilities across the entire drug discovery process. Two months later the company announced a further round of funding for $115 million<ref>{{cite web |last1=Reuters |title=AI drug hunter BenevolentAI worth $2 billion after fund raising |url=https://www.euronews.com/2018/04/19/ai-drug-hunter-benevolentai-worth-2-billion-after-fund-raising |website=EuroNews |publisher=EuroNews |accessdate=28 November 2018}}</ref>. In May of 2018, the company announced it had appointed Joanna Shields as CEO<ref>{{cite web |last1=Shead |first1=Sam |title=BenevolentAI Makes Joanna Shields New CEO |url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/samshead/2018/05/01/benevolentai-makes-joanna-shields-new-ceo/#54c99605b9cd |website=Forbes |publisher=Forbes |accessdate=27 November 2018}}</ref>.
== Solutions and Services == In 2016 BenevolentAI became the first European company to use a deep learning supercomputer to assist in the process of drug discovery, using the DGX-1 supercomputer to support its Judgment Augmented Correlation System (JACS)<ref>{{cite web |last1=Staines |first1=Richard |title=AI firm aims to revolutionise drug R&D with new UK facility |url=https://pharmaphorum.com/news/benevolentai-revolutionise-drug-rd-new-facility/ |website=pharmaphorum |publisher=pharmaphorum |accessdate=26 November 2018}}</ref>. The BenevolentAI Platform™ ingests data, reads, synthesizes, and contextualises data to determine the cause of a disease, proposes a drug target, makes a molecule to treat that disease and then defines the right patients to test that molecule in to drive greater clinical success<ref>{{cite web |title=BenevolentAI |url=https://www.crunchbase.com/organization/benevolent-ai#section-overview |website=Crunchbase |publisher=Crunchbase |accessdate=27 November 2018}}</ref>.
Their Platform™ is specifically used to design new molecules and extract hypotheses based on a knowledge graph detailing the relationships between genes, targets, diseases, proteins, and drugs<ref>{{cite web |last1=BenevolentAI |title=BenevolentAI Raises $115 Million to Extend Its Leading Global Position in the Field of AI Enabled Drug Development |url=https://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/benevolentai-raises-115-million-to-extend-its-leading-global-position-in-the-field-of-ai-enabled-drug-development-680180573.html |website=Pr Newswire |publisher=Cision |accessdate=26 November 2018}}</ref>. The company has announced it is working with the Sheffield Institute of Translational Neuroscience on a treatment for ALS<ref>{{cite web |last1=Rossi |first1=Ben |title=AI provides breakthrough in treatment for motor neuron disease |url=https://www.information-age.com/ai-provides-breakthrough-treatment-motor-neuron-disease-123466452/ |website=Information Age |publisher=Bonhill |accessdate=23 November 2018}}</ref>.
== BenevolentAI Award == In 2017 BenevolentAI announced the creation of the BenevolentAI Award, in partnership with the Association of Medical Research Charities. The award is given to a single applicant a year, allowing the winner to access the company’s technology to accelerate their medical research using artificial intelligence<ref>{{cite web |title=Annual award announced for medical research charities wishing to benefit from artificial intelligence |url=https://benevolent.ai/news/announcements/medical-ai-award-sets-its-sights-on-treating-parkinsons |website=BenevolentAI |publisher=BenevolentAI |accessdate=28 November 2018}}</ref>.
The winner of the 2018 award was a collaboration between the Parkinson’s UK and The Cure Parkinson’s Trust. Upon receiving the award, the group announced their aim to identify three treatments that can be repurposed for Parkinson’s and two novel drug targets<ref>{{cite web |last1=Hughes |first1=Owen |title=British AI firm lends smarts to Parkinson’s charities in hunt for new treatments |url=https://www.digitalhealth.net/2018/04/benevolent-ai-lens-artificial-intelligence-platform/ |website=Digital Health |publisher=Digital Health |accessdate=28 November 2018}}</ref>.
== Awards and Recognitions == '''2017''' * CB Insights, “AI 100”<ref>{{cite web |title=CB Insights Reveals the AI 100 List At The Innovation Summit |url=https://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/cb-insights-reveals-the-ai-100-list-at-the-innovation-summit-610394035.html |website=PR Newswire |publisher=Automat Technologies, Inc |accessdate=28 November 2018}}</ref> * Sunday Times Tech Track, “Ones to Watch”<ref>{{cite web |title=BRITAIN’S FASTEST-GROWING PRIVATE TECH COMPANIES REVEALED |url=http://www.fasttrack.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2017-Sunday-Times-Hiscox-Tech-Track-100-National-press-release.pdf |website=Fast Track |accessdate=28 November 2018}}</ref> * CPhI Awards Excellence in Pharma, “Pharma Company of the Year SME”<ref>{{cite web |title=Winners 2017 |url=https://awards.cphi.com/winners/2017-winners/ |website=CPhI Pharma Awards |publisher=UBM |accessdate=28 November 2018}}</ref> * The Europas, “Hottest AI Start-Up”<ref>{{cite web |title=THE HOTTEST TECH STARTUPS OF 2017 ROCKED LONDON AT THE EUROPAS AWARDS |url=https://theeuropas.com/2017/06/16/the-hottest-tech-startups-of-2017-rocked-london-at-the-europas-awards/ |website=The Europas |publisher=The Europas |accessdate=28 November 2018}}</ref>
'''2018''' * CogX, “Best AI Product in Healthcare”<ref>{{cite web |title=Awards Finalists |url=https://cogx.co/2018-awards-finalists/ |website=CogX |publisher=CogX |accessdate=28 November 2018}}</ref> * World Economic Forum, “Technology Pioneer Status”<ref>{{cite web |title=BenevolentAI Awarded Technology Pioneer Status by World Economic Forum |url=https://benevolent.ai/news/benevolentai-awarded-technology-pioneer-status-by-world-economic-forum |website=BenevolentAI |publisher=BenevolentAI |accessdate=28 November 2018}}</ref>
==References== {{reflist}}

revision.text:
{{Use dmy dates|date=August 2018}} {{Infobox company | name = Black Cube | logo = [[File:Black_Cube_Logo_on_black_bacground.jpg|250px]] | type = Private Limited Company | industry = Litigation Support
[[Competitive Intelligence]]
[[Risk and strategic consulting|Risk Consulting]] | foundation = 2010 | location_city = Tel Aviv & London | num_employees = 100+ | footnotes = | homepage = {{url|blackcube.com}} }} '''Black Cube''' is a [[private intelligence agency]], which is based in London, Paris and Tel Aviv,{{Cite web |url=http://www.blackcube.com/contact/ |title=Contact Us {{!}} Black Cube|last=|first=|date=|website=www.blackcube.com/contact/|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=16 September 2016}} and is the trading name of BC Strategy Ltd.Efrat Peretz, [http://www.globes.co.il/en/article-investigating-the-investigators-black-cube-1000914455 "Investigating thee investigators"] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150626141018/http://www.globes.co.il/en/article-investigating-the-investigators-black-cube-1000914455 |date=26 June 2015 }} "Globes" 3 February 2014 The company was founded in 2010Shuki Sadeh, [http://www.haaretz.com/business/.premium-1.609220 "Don’t cry for me"] "Haaretz" 8 August 2014 by former Israeli intelligence officersLiz Bolshaw, [http://www.ft.com/cms/s/0/e0133cf6-cd66-11e4-9144-00144feab7de.html "A new breed of commercial intelligence company"] "The Financial Times" 26 March 2015 Dan Zorella (in Hebrew: דן זורלא) and Avi Yanus (in Hebrew: אבי ינוס). Its employees include former members of [[Israeli Intelligence Community|Israeli intelligence]] units, including [[Military Intelligence Directorate (Israel)|Aman]], [[Mossad]] and [[Shin Bet]], as well as legal and financial experts. Black Cube’s main business is "litigation support", in which the company provides intelligence, evidence and advisory services in multi-jurisdictional legal and criminal cases. Black Cube's tactics have resulted in a number of international controversies. In Romania, two of its employees were convicted of criminal charges involving harassment and hacking. ==Notable projects== Beginning in 2011, Black Cube provided intelligence services to [[Vincent Tchenguiz]] in a number of cases, including Tchenguiz’s fight against the UK Serious Fraud Office, following his arrest as part of the SFO investigation into the collapse of the Icelandic bank [[Kaupthing]].Business Desk [https://www.bbc.com/news/business-12688072 "Robert and Vincent Tchenguiz arrested in Iceland probe"] "BBC" 10 March 2011 Black Cube analysed the network of relationships surrounding the collapse of the bank, and helped build a successful challenge to the SFO arrests and search warrants, causing the judge to declare the SFO’s actions unlawful in 2013.{{Cite news |url=http://e.forbes.co.il/behind-closed-doors-first-peek-into-the-israeli-company-that-captivates-global-interest/ |title=Inside Black Cube - The "Mossad" of the Business World - Forbes Israel |date=13 November 2017 |work=Forbes Israel|access-date=13 February 2018 |language=en-US}} Following this investigation the SFO was ordered by the court to pay over £3m to Tchenguiz in 2014, and to issue a formal apology.{{Cite web |url=https://www.sfo.gov.uk/2014/07/25/serious-fraud-office-vincent-tchenguiz-announce-settlement-civil-claims/ |title=The Serious Fraud Office and Vincent Tchenguiz announce settlement of civil claims |date=25 July 2014 |website=Serious Fraud Office|access-date=22 September 2016}}{{Cite web |url=https://www.ft.com/content/e0133cf6-cd66-11e4-9144-00144feab7de |title=Subscribe to read |website=Financial Times |language=en-GB|access-date=19 February 2018}} In 2014, Black Cube were hired by Israeli businessman [[Nochi Dankner]], to examine a court decision assigning control of IDB Holding Corp. Ltd. (TASE:IDBH) to Motti Ben Moshe. Black Cube investigated the sources of capital of Ben Moshe, revealing an ongoing investigation by German regulatory authorities into Ben Moshe’s company ExtraEnergy,Efrat Peretz, [http://www.globes.co.il/en/article-dankner-german-regulator-probing-ben-moshe-1000913719 "Dankner: German regulator probing Ben-Moshe"] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150626151616/http://www.globes.co.il/en/article-dankner-german-regulator-probing-ben-moshe-1000913719 |date=26 June 2015 }} "Globes" 30 January 2014 and locating a witness who held evidence of money laundering and tax evasion by Ben Moshe.Efrat Peretz, [http://www.globes.co.il/en/article-dankner-accuses-ben-moshe-of-money-laundering-1000924326 "Dankner accuses Ben-Moshe of money laundering"] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150626144234/http://www.globes.co.il/en/article-dankner-accuses-ben-moshe-of-money-laundering-1000924326 |date=26 June 2015 }} "Globes" 13 March 2014 Black Cube was hired to assist [[Kfar Giladi|Kfar Gildai]] Quarries in their highly publicised dispute with Caeserstone (NASDAQ:CSTE). Black Cube engaged a Caesarstone engineer in conversation during a group bicycle trip in Kfar Giladi. In the recording, the engineer contradicted the allegations that were made by Ceaserstone in the arbitration proceeding with Kfar Giladi. After six years of deliberations, Judge Boaz Okun ordered Caeserstone to pay more than $14m as compensation to Kfar Giladi. {{Cite web |url=http://www.globes.co.il/en/article-caesarstone-to-pay-kfar-giladi-nis-50m-compensation-1001220457 |title=CaesarStone to pay Kfar Giladi NIS 50m compensation - Globes English |last= |first= |date= |website=Globes |language=English|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=8 February 2018}} In 2015, Black Cube assisted Taiwanese businessman [[Nobu Su]], owner of the shipping company TMT, in his efforts to gain permission to appeal a 2014 judgement in favour of Lakatamia Shipping Unknown Author, [http://en.acnnewswire.com/press-release/english/19779/nobu-su-fights-back-against-lakatamia "Nobu Su Fights Back Against Lakatamia"] "ACN Newswire" 9 January 2015 in which Su was found personally liable for the amount of almost $47m.Unknown Author, [http://www.tradewindsnews.com/weekly/348219/UK-judge-declares-Nobu-Su-personally-liable-for-37.9m "Gone to the dogs?"] "Tradewinds" 7 November 2014 Black Cube delivered intelligence to Su’s legal team showing that 20% of the judgement amount was due to a company called Slagen Shipping, which had ceased operations at the time of the establishment of the claim, thereby rendering it unable to act as a claimant, both reducing the quantum of the judgement significantly, and causing the appeal to be granted.Japan Corporate News, [http://www.nasdaq.com/article/headway-for-nobu-su-20150414-00262 "Headway for Nobu Su"] "Nasdaq" 14 April 2015 In 2016, Black Cube was involved in exposing bribery and corruption in a set of Italian arbitrations between [[AmTrust Financial Services|AmTrust]] (NASDAQ:AFSI) and an Italian named Antonio Somma totalling €2bn.{{Cite news |url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2016-04-14/bullets-secret-tapes-and-bribery-claim-in-suit-against-italians |title=When Doing Business in Italy Means a Box of Bullets in the Mail |date=14 April 2016 |work=Bloomberg.com|access-date=13 February 2018 |language=en}} Somma admitted to the company's undercover agents that he could control the arbitration panels,Corriere della Sera, [http://www.corriere.it/digital-edition/CORRIEREFC_NAZIONALE_WEB/2016/04/14/25/il-lodo-da-2-miliardi-in-tribunale-corruzione-o-calunnia-per-larbitro_U43170723463763HLG.shtml "Il lodo da 2 miliardi in Tribunale Corruzione o calunnia per l’arbitro"] 14 April 2016 and that he had an agreement to pay the chair of the arbitration panel 10% of any money they awarded him.B1, [http://www.b1.ro/stiri/externe/black-cube-dezvaluie-cel-mai-mare-caz-de-coruptie-judiciara-din-italia-146717.html "Black Cube dezvăluie cel mai mare caz de corupție judiciară din Italia"] 16 April 2016 Following Black Cube's findings, the arbitrator was dismissed and in July 2016, the two sides reached a settlement on the total of 60 million euros instead of the initial 2 billion euro claim.{{Cite news |url=http://www.ilcorrierino.com/pace-milionaria-salvo-il-broker-antonio-somma/1857.html |title=Pace milionaria, salvo il broker Antonio Somma - Transazione tra AmTrust e l'assicuratore stabiese con un giro di affari all'estero |work=Il Corrierino|access-date=30 May 2018 |language=it-IT}} In 2016, Black Cube was hired by [[Rami Levy Hashikma Marketing|Rami Levy]], the owner of Rami Levy Chain Stores Hashikma Marketing (TASE:RMLI) who is considered a champion of low prices in Israel,{{Cite web |url=http://jewishbusinessnews.com/2013/04/28/who-is-rami-levy-and-why-do-investors-love-him-the-most/ |title=Who is Rami Levy and why investors love him |website=Jewish Business News|access-date=10 October 2016}} to verify his suspicions that he was being targeted by a rival chain in a negative media campaign. Black Cube provided Levy with evidence that the PR agent who worked for Levy's competitor, Victory supermarket chain, exposed the negative campaign that they carried out aimed at damaging Levy's public reputation. Levy later used those materials in a lawsuit against his competitor.{{Cite web |url=http://haaretz.com/israel-news/business/.premium-1.717297 |title=Rami Levy allegedly targeted by rival chain in negative media campaign - Business |website=haaretz.com|access-date=10 October 2016}} In 2016, [[Alstom]] (EPA:ALO) and Afcon (TASE:AFHL) hired Black Cube’s services in order to assist them with their dispute against the Israel Railways’ electrification bid, which the Spanish company SEMI won. Black Cube presented recordings of officials from the Israel Railway discussing malfunctions that occurred in the bid. Based on these findings, in January 2018, the Superior Court in Israel issued an agreement of compromise according to which the work on the railway will be divided between all three of the companies and that Black Cube’s clients’ work will be priced at 580 million NIS, after they originally lost the bid.{{Cite news |url=https://www.enr.com/articles/42365-israel-high-court-splits-disputed-500m-rail-power-contract?v=preview |title=Israel High Court Splits Disputed $500M Rail Power Contract|access-date=14 February 2018 |language=en}} In 2017, Gefen Biomed (TASE:GEFEN) filed a NIS 60 million lawsuit which claims that entrepreneurs Moshe (Mori) Arkin and others deliberately misled or deceived minority shareholders in biomed company cCam Biotherapeutics. The lawsuit is based on evidence collected by Black Cube, which conducted recorded interviews with key figures in cCam that prove a deliberate and systematic attempt to conceal exit talks with [[Merck & Co.|Merck]] (NYSE:MRK) for up to $625 million.{{Cite web |url=http://services.globes.co.il/en/article-lawsuit-claims-mori-arkin-misled-ecams-minority-shareholders-1001180305 |title=Lawsuit claims Arkin misled eCam shareholders - Globes English |website=Globes |language=he|access-date=13 March 2017}} Specialising in Asset Tracing and analysis of offshore companies and trusts, Black Cube was hired by [[Bank Hapoalim]]{{Cite web |url=http://www.globes.co.il/en/article-black-cube-the-mossad-style-business-intelligence-company-1001183611 |title=Black Cube - a "Mossad-style" business intelligence co - Globes English |website=Globes |language=he|access-date=18 February 2018}} (TASE: POLI) to trace the assets of Motti Zisser, who left behind a high debt to the bank. Black Cube provided intelligence of many assets in Europe which were transferred from Mr. Zisser to his son David through a sophisticated network of shell companies. Networks of hotels in Brussels, a hotel and mall district in Amsterdam, apartments in Strasbourg and a company in Hong Kong were located, among others. As a result of the intelligence gathered by Black Cube, Bank Hapoalim was granted an injunction that applies an effective freeze on all the companies of the Zisser Family. At the end of a legal process, the two parties came to a settlement in February 2018, according to which Zisser’s heirs would pay nearly 95 million NIS to Bank Hapoalim.{{Cite web |url=http://www.globes.co.il/en/article-zissers-heirs-to-pay-hapoalim-nis-95m-after-black-cube-uncovers-assets-1001224055 |title=Zisser’s heirs to pay Hapoalim NIS 95m after Black Cube uncovers assets - Globes English |website=Globes |language=he|access-date=16 February 2018}} ==Controversies== In 2013, Black Cube filed a lawsuit in the UK against Vincent Tchenguiz for unpaid invoices and breach of contract. Concurrently, Tchenguiz filed a lawsuit in Israel against Black Cube, alleging fraudulent invoices, an allegation denied by Black Cube. Both lawsuits were dropped in a settlement agreement, the details of which are undisclosed.{{cite news|first=Simon |last=Bowers, |url=https://www.theguardian.com/business/2013/apr/22/vincent-tchenguiz-settles-black-cube-dispute |title=Vincent Tchenguiz settles Black Cube legal dispute |work=The Guardian |date=22 April 2013 |accessdate=24 August 2018}} In April 2016, two of the company employees were arrested in Bucharest on suspicions of spying, phishing and cyber harassing the chief prosecutor of the Romanian [[National Anticorruption Directorate]], [[Laura Codruța Kövesi]] and people close to her. The two employees were eventually convicted on charges of hacking and harassment.{{Cite news |url=https://www.romania-insider.com/israeli-citizen-gets-probation-after-pleading-guilty-in-espionage-case-in- |title=Israeli citizen gets probation after pleading guilty in espionage case in Romania}}{{Cite news |url=https://www.timesofisrael.com/israeli-convicted-for-targeting-romanias-anti-corruption- |title=Israeli convicted for targeting Romania’s anti-corruption chief}} After sentencing, the company reached an understanding with the Romanian authorities and the two employees were released and returned to Israel after a few months.{{Cite web |url=http://www.globes.co.il/en/article-black-cube-the-mossad-style-business-intelligence-company-1001183611 |title=Black Cube - a "Mossad-style" business intelligence co |website=Globes |language=he|access-date=22 May 2017}} At the time of the arrest, Black Cube denied any wrongdoing, saying that they were working under contract from the highest political powers in Bucharest and that "all of Black Cube’s employees follow local law to the letter, and the allegations against them are unfounded and untrue".[http://www.algemeiner.com/2016/04/06/report-claims-romania-investigating-4-israelis-for-spying/# "Report Claims Romania Investigating 4 Israelis for Spying"] "Algemeiner" 6 April 2016 The Romanian government and Romanian Police denied the existence of any such contract.[[Attila Somfalvi]], Itamar Eichner [http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4788160,00.html "Employees of Israeli business intelligence firm Black Cube is suspected of spying on the director of Romania's Anticorruption Directorate; company denies allegations."] "Israel News" 9 April 2016 In November 2017, [[Ronan Farrow]] reported in ''[[The New Yorker]]'' that film executive [[Harvey Weinstein]] hired Black Cube in order to stop the publication of the abuse allegations against him. Using false identities, private investigators from Black Cube tracked and met journalists and actresses, in particular [[Rose McGowan]], who later publicly accused Weinstein of rape. Over the course of a year, Weinstein had Black Cube and other agencies "target, or collect information on, dozens of individuals, and compile psychological profiles that sometimes focussed on their personal or sexual histories."Ronan Farrow, Harvey Weinstein’s Army of Spies. ''New Yorker'' 6 November 2017 https://www.newyorker.com/news/news-desk/harvey-weinsteins-army-of-spiesHarvey Weinstein Hired ex-Mossad Agents to Track Women Accusing Him of Sexual Assault. ''Haaretz'' 7 November 2017 https://www.haaretz.com/us-news/1.821445Jim Rutenberg. 7 November 2017. “Report Details Weinstein’s Covert Attempt to Halt Publication of Accusations New York Times” https://www.nytimes.com/2017/11/07/us/harvey-weinstein-new-yorker.html?_r=0 In November 2017, Black Cube set up a fake recruitment firm, and flew an employee and a former employee of a hedge fund company to London for fake job interviews, in order to gain proprietary information about the hedge fund, according to ''[[The New York Times]]''. Black Cube refused to comment. In New York State, private investigators are required to be licensed, but the Times couldn't find a record of a license for Black Cube or B.C. Strategy.[https://www.nytimes.com/2017/11/15/business/deception-and-ruses-fill-the-toolkit-of-investigators-used-by-weinstein.html Deception and Ruses Fill the Toolkit of Investigators Used by Weinstein]. By MATTHEW GOLDSTEIN and WILLIAM K. RASHBAUM. New York Times. 15 November 2017 In March 2018, Black Cube and [[Cambridge Analytica]] each denied a Cambridge Analytica ex-employee’s statement that the company had hired Black Cube's services. In April 2018, Brittany Kaiser, a senior manager at Cambridge Analytica affirmed the denials and testified in front of the British Parliament that Black Cube is not the company they worked with.{{Cite web |url=https://www.parliament.uk/documents/commons-committees/culture-media-and-sport/Brittany%20Kaiser%20Parliamentary%20testimony%20FINAL.pdf |title=Written testimony to the Fake News Inquiry |author=Brittany Kaiser|access-date=7 May 2018}}{{Cite web |url=https://sputniknews.com/science/201804171063653258-cambridge-analytica-testimony-facebook-kaiser/ |title='There Were Chinese Walls': Ex-Cambridge Analytica Employee Testifies |last=Sputnik |website=sputniknews.com |language=en|access-date=18 April 2018}} In May 2018, Black Cube was accused of using false identities to seek damaging information about former Obama administration officials and help the Trump administration undermine the [[Joint Comprehensive Plan of Action|Iran nuclear deal]].{{Cite news |url=https://www.newyorker.com/news/news-desk/israeli-operatives-that-aided-harvey-weinstein-collected-information-on-former-obama-administration-officials |title=Israeli Operatives Who Aided Harvey Weinstein Collected Information on Former Obama Administration Officials |last=Farrow |first=Ronan |date=6 May 2018 |work=The New Yorkers|access-date=7 May 2018 |language=en}} Black Cube has responded by stating that it has no relation to the Trump administration, to Trump aides or to the Iran nuclear deal.{{Cite news |url=https://www.haaretz.com/us-news/more-details-on-israeli-spy-firm-ops-against-ex-obama-aides-revealed-1.6061080 |title=More Details on Israeli Spy Firm Black Cube's 'Ops Against ex-Obama Officials' Revealed |last=Tibon |first=Amir |date=7 May 2018 |work=Haaretz|access-date=7 May 2018 |language=en}} In August 2018, ''[[The New Yorker]]'' connected Black Cube's research to a memo which circulated in the Trump White House in early 2017 and alleged that former Obama officials were conspiring with reporters "to undermine President Trump's foreign policy" to save [[Obamacare]] and the Iran deal.{{cite web |last1=Entous |first1=Adam |last2=Farrow |first2=Ronan |url=https://www.newyorker.com/news/news-desk/the-conspiracy-memo-aimed-at-obama-aides-that-circulated-in-the-trump-white-house |title=The Conspiracy Memo About Obama Aides That Circulated in the Trump White House |work=The New Yorker |date=23 August 2018 |accessdate=24 August 2018}} ==International Advisory Board== * [[Meir Dagan]] (Deceased) - Former head of [[Mossad]], Honorary President of the Board.{{Cite web |url=http://www.blackcube.com/board/ |title=Advisory Board {{!}} Black Cube|website=www.blackcube.com|access-date=15 August 2016}} *[[Efraim Halevy]] - Former head of [[Mossad]], headed the National Security Council and the Hebrew University Center for Strategic Studies.{{Cite news|url=https://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-5397148,00.html|title=Former Mossad chief joins Black Cube|date=2018-12-11|work=Ynetnews|access-date=2018-11-12|language=en}} *[[Yohanan Danino]] - Former [[Israel Police|Israeli Police]] Commissioner, served as Chairman of Migdal Insurance Group.{{Cite news|url=https://www.calcalistech.com/ctech/articles/0,7340,L-3741766,00.html|title=Spy Firm Black Cube Adds Former Israeli Police Chief to Advisory Board|date=5 July 2018|work=CTECH - www.calcalistech.com|access-date=13 August 2018}}{{Cite news|url=https://www.intelligenceonline.com/corporate-intelligence/2018/07/11/black-cube-lands-security-heavyweight,108316541-bre|title=ISRAEL : Black Cube lands security heavyweight|date=11 July 2018|work=Intelligence Online|access-date=13 August 2018|language=en-US}} * Major General [[Giora Eiland]]{{Cite web |url=http://blackcube.com/ |title=Black Cube {{!}} Creative Intelligence {{!}} BlackCube|website=blackcube.com|language=en-GB|access-date=26 August 2017}} - Former head of the Israeli [[National Security Council (Israel)|National Security Council]], headed the [[Operations Directorate|IDF’s Operation Branch]] and [[Planning Directorate|IDF’s Planning Branch]]. * Professor [[Asher Tishler]] - President of the College of Management Academic Studies * Brigadier General Mati Leshem{{Cite web |url=http://www.blackcube.com/board/ |title=Advisory Board {{!}} Black Cube|website=www.blackcube.com|access-date=16 September 2016}} - Recipient of the 1997 Israel Defence PrizeUnknown Author, [http://www.themarker.com/markets/1.494929 "Mati Leshem appointed CEO of Auto-Center"] "The Marker" 20 February 2007 * Paul Reyniershttps://www.jc-bingo.com/details/00AA788F/blackcube-com - Former partner at [[Price Waterhouse]] and author of GARP (Generally Accepted Risk Principles){{cite web |url=http://www.reyniersco.com/Reyniers_&_Co._Limited/Paul_Reyniers.html |title=Archived copy |accessdate=6 May 2015 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160304002859/http://www.reyniersco.com/Reyniers_%26_Co._Limited/Paul_Reyniers.html |archivedate=4 March 2016}} * Itiel Maayan - Member of [[Microsoft]]'s Customer Advisory Board * Lieutenant Colonel Golan Malka - Former Vice President Marketing and Business Development of [[NICE Systems]]{{cite web |url=http://www.zoominfo.com/s/#!search/profile/person?personId=1623918211&targetid=profile |title=Business Profiles and Company Information - ZoomInfo.com |author= |date= |website=www.zoominfo.com |accessdate=14 April 2018}} ==References== {{reflist}} * * * * ==External links== * {{Official|https://www.blackcube.com/}} [[Category:2010 establishments in Israel]] [[Category:Business intelligence companies]] [[Category:Companies based in Tel Aviv]] [[Category:Companies established in 2010]] [[Category:Private detectives and investigators]] [[Category:Private intelligence agencies]]

revision.comment: /* Examples of business operating systems */
revision.text:
The term '''business operating system''' ('''BOS''') refers to standard, enterprise-wide collection of [[business process]]es used in many diversified industrial companies. The definition has also been extended to include the common structure, principles and practices necessary to drive the organization.<ref>{{cite book | title = Hope Is Not a Strategy | author = Ted Gee | page = 85 | publisher = Dog Ear | year = 2008 | isbn = 978-1-59858-767-8 }}</ref>
Diversified industrial companies like [[Ingersoll Rand]], [[Honeywell]], and [[Danaher Corporation|Danaher]] have adopted a standard, common collection of business processes and/or [[business process management|business process improvement methodologies]] which they use to manage strategy development and execution. In the case of [[Danaher]], the business system is a core part of the company's culture, is seen as one of the key drivers of corporate performance, and is therefore a differentiator for shareholders and prospective employees.
The objectives of such systems are to ensure daily work is focused on the organisation's strategic objectives and is done in the most efficient way. The systems deal with the questions "why" (purpose of the work), "what" (specific objectives of the work) and "how" (the processes used to do the work). The Toyota Production System is focused on both how to make cars, and how to improve the way cars are made. A third objective can also be added, which is to improve the business system itself by identifying or improving the component tools and techniques.
== Terminology. == Terms used to describe such systems include: * XPS - meaning “Company-specific Production System" with the X standing in place of the company name * Business System * Management Operating System
== Examples of business operating systems == * [[Toyota]]'s [[Toyota Production System]] (TPS) is one of the earliest examples, developed between 1948 and 1975 * [[Danaher]] is well known for its Danaher Business System (DBS)<ref>http://www.danaher.com/how-we-work/danaher-business-system</ref> * [[Fortive]] (a company that split from Danaher in 2016) has the Fortive Business System (FBS) which is derived from the DBS<ref>http://www.fortive.com/fortive-business-system</ref> * [[Ingersoll Rand]] established the Ingersoll Rand business operating system (BOS) to describe the six enterprise focus areas and its process improvement method ([[Lean Six Sigma]]). * [[Honeywell]] has the Honeywell Operating System (HOS)<ref>http://www.honeywell.com/who-we-are/our-initiatives/hos-gold</ref> * [[Idex Corporation]] has the Idex Operating Model <ref>http://www.idexcorp.com/about/about_strategy.asp</ref> * [http://www.etw.com/ ETW (Execute to Win)] * Bosch Production System * Boeing Production System * Audi Production System * Lego Production System * John Deere Quality and Production System * Alcoa Business System * REC Production System * Electrolux Manufacturing System * Novo Nordisk - "cLEAN” * Trumpf - “Synchro” * Magellan Operating System ([[Magellan Aerospace]])
== List of common features == Many of business operating systems share common features. This is because the systems are derived from other known systems, and from established methods and practices for business management. The following is a list of features that appear in several systems. * Hoshin Kanri, a strategic planning methodology developed by [[Yoji Akao]], used to create goals, assign them measurable milestones, and assess progress against those milestones (Hoshin Kanri is also referred to as Policy Deployment or X-Matrix) * Standard work - the best and most reliable methods and sequences for each work process which is used as the basis for sustaining improvements * Process improvement methodologies: [[Lean Six Sigma|Lean]], [[Six Sigma]], and [[Kaizen]] are popular approaches incorporated in business systems * [[Just-in-time manufacturing|Just-in-time]] manufacturing * [[Gemba]] walks * Jidoka - "automation with a human touch" where human intervention is used to improve machine performance * Visual controls or visual management where management processes (e.g. checking) use simple graphics to show problems at a glance * Problem solving techniques such as [[root cause analysis]] * Technology: While these standard business operating systems may inform or be linked to a company's technology platform, they more commonly refer to the way the company manages complex business processes in a common way across its diverse portfolio of businesses.
== References == {{reflist}}
[[Category:Business terms]]

{{Unreferenced|date=December 2009}} '''Carlos Staiger''' (born '''Karl Staiger'''; [[Eningen unter Achalm]], 1907 — [[Porto Alegre]], 1997) was an [[enterpriser]] of the [[industry|industrial]] and [[agricultural]] [[economic sectors]] that emigrated from [[Germany]] to [[Brazil]] in the 1930s. Staiger also founded several important [[Trade association|associations]] and wrote a book named ''O Capital Humano''.
==External links== * [http://www.staiger.com.br/ Staiger Indústria e Comércio Ltda.]

revision.comment: add relation to token money, ref
revision.text:
{{refimprove|date=January 2017}} [[File:April 2013 to March 2014 Import commodities from India, by percent value in US$.png|thumb|Indian commodity imports in US$]] In the field of [[economics]], the '''[[commodity]] value''' of a [[economic good|good]] is its [[free market]] [[Intrinsic value (ethics)|intrinsic value]] under optimal use conditions. In a free market, the commodity value of a good will be reflected by its price. For example, if an acre of land can yield a net of 100 dollars loss by lying [[fallow]], 50 dollars gain by being planted with corn, and 100 dollars gain by being planted with wheat, then that acre's commodity value is 100 dollars; the farmer is assumed to put his land to best use. The price of a commodity fluctuates around its commodity value.<ref name="cam">{{cite book |title=Consumption and Management: New Discovery and Applications |last=Wu |first=Bingxin |year=2011 |publisher=Elsevier |isbn=9781908818072 |url=https://play.google.com/store/books/details?id=pIpwAgAAQBAJ |accessdate=4 January 2017}}</ref>
== Currency == A commodity value expressed as a [[price]] is determined by historical, social and cultural aspects of production and distribution.<ref name="macu">{{cite book |title=Material Culture in America: Understanding Everyday Life |last=Sheumaker |first=Helen |author2=Shirley Teresa Wajda |year=2008 |publisher=ABC-CLIO |isbn=9781576076477 |page=299 |url=https://play.google.com/store/books/details?id=JjVlAzj9qDQC |accessdate=3 January 2017}}</ref> [[Karl Marx]] described price as the money-name for the [[Labour economics|labour]] realised in a commodity.<ref name="caac">{{cite book |title=Capital: A Critique of Political Economy - The Process of Capitalist Production |last=Marx |first=Karl |year=2007 |publisher=Cosimo, Inc |isbn=9781605200064 |page=114 |url=https://play.google.com/store/books/details?id=sxQl44nJmjwC |accessdate=3 January 2017}}</ref> A commodity value is dependent on its [[utility]].<ref name="tvom">{{cite book |title=The Value of Money |last=Anderson |first=B. M. |year=1922 |publisher=Ludwig von Mises Institute |isbn=9781610162777 |page=15 |url=https://play.google.com/store/books/details?id=PzrKq7x06MQC |accessdate=3 January 2017}}</ref>
Commodity value is of particular significance in the study of currency. For example, the commodity value of a coin is the value of the metal of which it is made. Gold and silver coins have a high commodity value, whereas [[fiat money|fiat]] coins such as modern day [[Quarter (United States coin)|quarters]] have a low commodity value. This is of particular historical relevance when analyzed in light of [[Gresham's Law]].
Because money becomes valuable not due to its substance, that is, its commodity value, but rather because of its performance, currencies tend to become [[token money|token]].<ref name="ncsp">{{cite book |title=Nature, Choice and Social Power |last=Schoenberger |first=Erica |year=2014 |publisher=Routledge |isbn=1135051585 |page=98 |url=https://books.google.com.au/books?id=TO5TBAAAQBAJ |accessdate=4 January 2017}}</ref>
== Debt == [[Asset]] backed [[debt]] has a commodity value equal to the price of the [[Collateral (finance)|collateral]]; a loan backed by a house has a commodity value equal to the free market price of the house. Non-collateralized debt, on the other hand, does not have a commodity value; it is valuable only insofar as it is repaid.
== Investment == Commodity value is an important consideration in hedging against [[inflation]]. Whereas fiat currencies can devalue, often [[hyperinflation|catastrophically]], currencies with considerable commodity value are known to better maintain their value; a government can print as many fiat bills as it wants with relative ease, the same is not true of mining [[precious metals]]. This leads some investors to purchase goods and debts with high commodity value, which are inherently safer than those with low, or no commodity value, minimizing risk by sacrificing potential return.
==See also== {{Portal|Business and Economics}} * [[Commodity market]] * [[Gold as an investment]]
==References== {{Reflist}}
[[Category:Commodities used as an investment]] [[Category:Business terms]]
{{economic-term-stub}}

revision.text:
'''Cyril St. John Stevenson''' (July 13, 1914 – November 6, 2006) was a [[Bahamas|Bahamian]] [[politician]] and newspaper publisher. Stevenson, Sir [[Henry Milton Taylor]] and [[William Cartwright (Bahamian politician)|William Cartwright]], co-founded the [[Progressive Liberal Party]] (PLP) in 1953, the first national [[political party]] to be established in the Bahamas.<ref name=tribune>{{cite news|first=Celeste|last=Nixon|title= PLP Founder Cartwright Dies |url=http://www.tribune242.com/news/2012/jun/08/plp-founder-cartwright-dies/ |work=[[Bahamas Tribune]] |publisher=|date=2012-06-08 |accessdate=2012-07-01}}</ref><ref name=ng>{{cite news|first=Royston|last=Jones Jr.|title= PLP Co-founder William Cartwright Dies at 89 |url=http://www.thenassauguardian.com/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=31526&Itemid=27 |work=[[Nassau Guardian]] |publisher=|date=2012-06-08 |accessdate=2012-07-01}}</ref><ref name=fn>{{cite news|first=|last=|title=Official memorial service set for Stevenson|url=http://freeport.nassauguardian.net/national_local/299906924382967.php|work=[[Freeport News]]|publisher=|date=2006-11-16|accessdate=2012-07-01|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://archive.is/20130221215638/http://freeport.nassauguardian.net/national_local/299906924382967.php|archivedate=2013-02-21|df=}}</ref>
==Biography== Stevenson was born in [[Nassau, Bahamas]], on July 13, 1914.<ref name=fn/> He was the youngest child of Henry Macauley "Harry" Stevenson and Georgianna Louise "Lulie" Stevenson.<ref name=fn/> His father died in 1915 when he was just fifteen months old.<ref name=fn/> He began a career in journalism as a reporter for the ''[[Bahamas Weekly News]]''.<ref name=fn/>
In 1953, Stevenson, Sir [[Henry Milton Taylor]] and [[William Cartwright (Bahamian politician)|William Cartwright]], co-founded the [[Progressive Liberal Party]] (PLP).<ref name=fn/> The following year, Stevenson became the [[newspaper editor|editor]] and [[newspaper publisher|publisher]] of the now defunct newspaper, ''[[The Nassau Herald]]''.<ref name=fn/> At times, Stevenson used his editorial control of the ''Nassau Guardian'' to promote the views and candidates of his PLP party.<ref name=fn/>
Stevenson was elected to the [[Bahamas House of Assembly]], the lower house of Parliament, from the [[Nichollstown and Berry Islands|Andros and the Berry Islands]] [[constituency]] in 1956.<ref name=fn/> He joined the "Magnificent Six," a group of six MPs who formed the first opposition block in the Bahamas parliament.<ref name=fn/> The group of six PLP parliamentary members consisted of Stevenson, [[Randol Fawkes]], [[Lynden Pindling]], [[Milo Butler]], Sammy Isaacs, and [[Clarence Bain]].<ref name=fn/> Stevenson was re-elected to the Assembly in the 1962 election, again representing portions of [[Andros Island]] and the [[Berry Islands]].<ref name=fn/> He lost his re-election in 1967, when he was as an independent candidate and left the PLP.<ref name=fn/>
He retired from politics after his 1967 electoral defeat.<ref name=fn/> Stevenson became head of the [[Bahamas Information Services]], a government department, in 1970.<ref name=fn/> He gave control of his printing business to family members that same year to focus on his work with the Bahamas Information Services. He remained head of the Bahamas Information Services until his retirement in 1985.<ref name=fn/>
Stevenson was made a Member of the [[Royal Victorian Order]] in 1975.<ref name=fn/> He received an award for contributions to journalism by The Bahamas Press Club in 1999.<ref name=fn/> In 2000, Jones Communication Limited named Stevenson as a member of the 100 Most Outstanding Bahamians of the 20th Century.<ref name=fn/>
Stevenson resided at his home at South Beach, [[New Providence]], from 1961 to 2006.<ref name=fn/>
Cyril Stevenson died on November 6, 2006, at the age of 92. He was survived by his wife of 47 years, June Ellen Stevenson ([[née]] Maplethorpe), and five children - William, Rae, Grace, Michael and Clarke.<ref name=fn/> A state funeral was held at the [[Christ Church Cathedral, Nassau|Christ Church Cathedral]] in Nassau on November 16, 2006.<ref name=fn/>
==References== {{reflist}}
{{authority control}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Stevenson, Cyril}} [[Category:1914 births]] [[Category:2006 deaths]] [[Category:Members of the House of Assembly of the Bahamas]] [[Category:Progressive Liberal Party politicians]] [[Category:Bahamian businesspeople]] [[Category:Bahamian newspaper editors]] [[Category:Bahamian journalists]] [[Category:Bahamian newspaper publishers (people)]] [[Category:People from Nassau, Bahamas]]

{{unreferenced|date=July 2011}} {{Infobox settlement <!-- Basic info ----------------> |name =Downtown Compton <!-- at least one of the first two fields must be filled in --> |nickname =Downtown C.P.T |image_skyline = Compton martin luther king monument.jpg |imagesize = |image_caption = The Martin Luther King Monument in front of the Compton City Hall and the Superior Court building. The monument is the logo for the city and is featured on signage. <!-- Location ------------------> |coordinates = |subdivision_type = Country |subdivision_name = United States |subdivision_type1 = State |subdivision_name1 = California |subdivision_type2 = County |subdivision_name2 = [[Los Angeles County, California|County of Los Angeles]] }}
'''Downtown Compton''' is the major business district of [[Compton, California]]. Downtown Compton started out as a thriving and safe environment throughout the early 1950s to the mid-1970s. When gang violence and robberies sparked in the 70s businesses began to move out and relocate leaving Downtown Compton a [[ghost town]]. It is now home to many businesses, two shopping centers, and the [[Martin Luther King Jr. Transit Center]]. The [[Metro Blue Line (LACMTA)]] now currently runs through 'Downtown Compton making travel to the city much easier.
== History ==
=== 1950s-1970s === Throughout the 1950s to early 1970s Downtown Compton was a major business district and home to many companies. During weekends streets would be packed and filled with shoppers, especially during the holidays.
=== 1970s-1980s === During the late '70s the face of Downtown Compton began to take a drastic turn. Robberies and ongoing gang violence due to the primarily African-American street gangs the [[Crips]] and the [[Bloods]], businesses began to move elsewhere to avoid further problems.
=== 1980s-1990s === During the late 80s the face of [[Compton, California|Compton]] began to change with new mayor, [[Omar Bradley]], This included the construction of the new [[Compton Town Center]]. Around this time the [[Metro Rail (Los Angeles County)|Los Angeles County Metro Rail System]] began adding the finishing touches to the [[Metro Blue Line (LACMTA)|Metro Blue Line]] that runs straight through Downtown Compton on the median of [[Willowbrook Avenue]]. This led to the construction of the new [[Martin Luther King Jr. Transit Center]], also located on '''Willowbrook''' along with the [[Compton (LACMTA station)|Metro Blue Line Compton Station]].
== Recent Years == Downtown Compton is now home to the following businesses.
*[[Martin Luther King Jr, Transit Center]] *[[Compton Town Center]] *Renaissance Plaza *[[Compton Courthouse]] {{Compton, California}} {{coord|33.8962|-118.2277|type:adm3rd_globe:earth_region:US-CA|display=title}}
[[Category:Central business districts in the United States|Compton]] [[Category:Compton, California]]
